column27: Description

column1: Voicemail App: The user is not redirected to the payment or purchase page while clicking on the “PURCHASE FOR ONLY $2.99” button
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Install and launch the "Get Personal Voicemail" application.

 # On the welcome popup, click the *"PURCHASE FOR ONLY $2.99"* button

*Actual result:*  The user is not redirected to the payment or purchase page while clicking on the “PURCHASE FOR ONLY $2.99” button - see here [^Screen_recording_20250603_212624.mp4]

*Expected result:* The button should redirect the user to the correct payment screen for performing the payment

column1: Voicemail App: No pop-up appears after the trial expires, and the user can continue to use all features without any restriction
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Install and open the Get Personal application
 # Use the app until the trial period expires
 # Monitor for any pop-up or access restriction after expiry

*Actual result:* No pop-up appears after the trial expires, and the user can continue to use all features without any restriction

*Expected result:* A notification should appear stating “Your trial period expires in 3 DAYS / PURCHASE” (as shown in the design), and the user should be restricted from using features after the trial ends - see here [^Voicemail_trial_v1b.png] & [^Voicemail_trial_v1c.png]

column1: Voicemail App: On installing the application, the pop-up shows: “Try Voicemail FREE for 2 weeks” instead of 3 days as specified
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Begin installation of the application
 # Observe the trial period duration displayed after the installation 

*Actual result:* On installing the application, the pop-up shows: “Try Voicemail FREE for 2 weeks” instead of 3 days as specified - See here [^Screenshot_20250603_191548.png]

*Expected result:* As per the approved design specification, the trial period should be clearly mentioned as: “Try Voicemail FREE for 3 days”

column1: Greetings: The scrollbar and contact list overlap with each other
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Edit a greeting 

 # Tap Select a recepient/group

 # Observe the alignment between the scrollbar and the contact list

*Actual result:* The scrollbar and contact list overlap with each other - see here [^Screenshot_20250603_194841.png]

*Expected result:* The scrollbar should be properly aligned beside the contact list without any overlap, maintaining consistent layout and readability - see here [^Voicemail_contacts_v1c.png]

column1: Greetings: Contacts and groups remain selected after navigating back from the selection screen
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Enter any of the greetings 
 # Tap to Select Recipients/ Select Group
 # Select any contacts or group
 # Press the Back button without saving

*Actual result:* Contacts and groups remain selected after navigating back from the selection screen - see here [^minor.mp4]

*Expected result:* Selections should be cleared when navigating back without confirming or saving, ensuring a fresh selection state on next entry

column1: Front interface: Divider between "Greetings" and "Quick Status" tabs is not present as required in the design specification
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Observe the top navigation bar between the Greetings and Quick Status tabs

*Actual result:* Divider between "Greetings" and "Quick Status" tabs is not present as required in the design specification - see here [^Screenshot_20250603_163600.png]

*Expected result:* As per the design file, there should be a visible divider line between the two tabs for better section separation - see here [^Voicemail_status_v1.png]

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: The playback time does not highlight during recording a new audio message as required in the design specification
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings or Quick Status tab
 # Create a new one
 # Record the audio message
 # Observe whether the playback time dynamically highlights while running

*Actual result:* The playback time does not highlight during recording a new audio message as required in the design specification - see here [^Minor GUI - time stamp.mp4]

*Expected result:* The playback time should highlight dynamically while the audio is playing, as per the design requirements - see here [^Voicemail_record_v1_1c.png]

column1: Greetings: The pointer appears before the search logo, not after it as required in the design specification
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings section
 # Tap to add or edit a greeting
 # Tap to "Select a group/ Select a recepient"
 # When redirected to the Contact List page, observe the search bar

*Actual result:* The pointer appears before the search logo, not after it as required in the design specification - see here [^Minor- Functional- The pointer.mp4]

*Expected result:* The pointer should be positioned after the search logo, following the design specifications

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: Inconsistent behavior of pause/resume button when frequently toggled during playing
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to any Greeting or Quick Status
 # Play the voice message
 # Repeatedly click the Pause and Resume buttons in quick succession during playing

*Actual result:*  Inconsistent behavior of the pause/resume button when frequently toggled during playing - see here [^Minor- GUI pause button.mp4]

*Expected result:* The Pause/Resume button should respond accurately to user input every time

column1: Greetings: Select Recepients: The Search field is missing the required underline as specified in the design file
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the GREETINGS > Select Recepients
 # Locate the Search field at the top of the screen
 # Observe whether the underline is present

*Actual result:* The Search field is missing the required underline as specified in the design file - see here [^Minor- GUI Search.mp4]

*Expected result:* The Search field should contain an underline below the placeholder according to the design specifications - see here [^Voicemail_contacts_v1b.png]

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: Delete icon appears as a trash bin instead of a cross as per design guideline
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to Create New Greeting

 # Observe the icon next to the Discard button

*Actual result:* Delete icon appears as a trash bin instead of a cross as per design guideline - see here [^Screenshot_20250603_123358.png]

*Expected result:* The Discard button should use a cross (×) icon to match the intended UI design - see here [^Voicemail_record_v1_1d.png]

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: Recording stops after 8.9 seconds but interface continues to show "RECORDING" with active Resume button
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to Create New Greeting or Quick Status
 # Start recording a voice message
 # Continue recording beyond 8.9 seconds

*Actual result:* Recording stops after 8.9 seconds but interface continues to show "RECORDING" with active Resume button - see here [^Minor-recording.mp4]

*Expected result:* The UI should stop displaying the recording state when the actual recording stops and reset the resume status accordingly

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: Play button remains unselected when a greeting or quick status is selected
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to Greetings or Quick Status
 # Tap on any voice message to begin playback
 # Observe the play button during and after selection

*Actual result:* Play button remains unselected when a greeting or quick status is selected - see here [^Screenshot_20250603_121053.png]

*Expected result:* all the elements, including the play button should be selected while selecting any greetings or quick status

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: "Discard" and "Save" buttons should be in all caps ("DISCARD", "SAVE") as per design
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to Create New Greeting or Quick Status

 # Record or enter information and observe the action buttons

*Actual result:*  "Discard" and "Save" buttons should be in all caps ("DISCARD", "SAVE") as per design - see here [^Screenshot_20250603_114736-1.png] & [^Screenshot_20250603_114719-1.png]

*Expected result:* The buttons should be labeled in all uppercase as "DISCARD" and "SAVE" to match the design guidelines - see here [^Voicemail_record_v1_1d.png]
column143:
03/Jun/25 9:43 AM;m13.hasan;*Steps in corrected order:* 
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to Create New Greeting or Quick Status
 # Record or enter information and observe the action buttons;;;

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: Elements such as text and icons are not centered within the Save and Discard buttons as required design
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to Greetings or Quick Status tab
 # Create a new greeting or status
 # Observe the alignment of text and icon in Save and Discard buttons
 # Compare their placement with the required design file

*Actual result:* Elements such as text and icons are not centered within the Save and Discard buttons as required design - see here [^Screenshot_20250603_114736.png] & [^Screenshot_20250603_114719.png]

*Expected result:* All elements should be perfectly centered within their respective buttons, ensuring consistency with the design file - see here [Voicemail_record_v1_1d.png]

column1: Greetings: "GET PERSONAL" appears instead of "Select Group" in the Contact List page
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings section
 # Tap to add or edit a greeting
 # Tap to "Select a group"
 # When redirected to the Contact List page, observe the header text

*Actual result:* "GET PERSONAL" appears instead of "Select Group" in the Contact List page - see here [^Minor - GUI.mp4]

*Expected result:* The header should display "Select Group" to clearly indicate the purpose of the page - see here [^Voicemail_groups_v1a.png]

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: The playback time does not highlight during audio playback as required in the design specification
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings or Quick Status tab
 # Select any of them from the list
 # Play the audio message
 # Observe whether the playback time dynamically highlights while running

*Actual result:* The playback time does not highlight during audio playback as required in the design specification - see here [^The playback time should be highlighted.mp4]

*Expected result:* The playback time should highlight dynamically while the audio is playing, as per the design requirements - see here [^Voicemail_record_v1_1d.png]

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: Displays "STOPED" instead of "PAUSE" during voice message recording
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to Create New Greeting or Quick Status
 # Start recording a new voice message
 # Observe the button during the recording process (pause and resume)

*Actual result:* Displays "STOPED" instead of "PAUSE" during voice message recording - see here [^Shows Stoped instead of paused-1.mp4]

*Expected result:* The label should display "PAUSE" as per the design specification - see here [^Voicemail_record_v1_1u-1.png]

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: The Progress bar does not visually indicate the length of the ongoing recording
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to Create New Greeting or Quick Status
 # Start recording a voice message
 # Observe the progress bar during the recording process

*Actual result:* The Progress bar does not visually indicate the length of the ongoing recording - see here [^minor_aa.mp4]

*Expected result:* The progress bar should have a dynamic highlighted section that increases in real-time to reflect the duration of the recording as it progresses - see here [^Voicemail_record_v1_1b.png]

column1: Greetings: "GET PERSONAL" appears instead of "New Greeting" in the header of the page
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings section
 # Tap to Create new greeting
 # When redirected to the next page, observe the header text

*Actual result:* "GET PERSONAL" appears instead of "New Greeting" in the header of the page - see here [^Should show New Greeting here .mp4]

*Expected result:* The header should display "New Greeting" to clearly indicate the purpose of the page - see here [^Voicemail_contacts_v1a.png]

column1: Greetings: "GET PERSONAL" appears instead of "Select Recepients" in the Contact List page
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings section
 # Tap to add or edit a greeting
 # Tap to "Select a recepient"
 # When redirected to the Contact List page, observe the header text

*Actual result:* "GET PERSONAL" appears instead of "Select Recepients" in the Contact List page - see here [^Select Recepients should show here.mp4]

*Expected result:* The header should display "Select Recepients" to clearly indicate the purpose of the page - see here [^Voicemail_contacts_v1a.png]

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: The label displays "Select a recepient" instead of "Select Recepients" while creating a new one
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app-
 # Navigate to any of the Greetings or Quick Status 
 # Locate the label displaying "Select a recepient"
 # Compare with the expected text in the design specification

*Actual result:*  The label displays "Select a recepient" instead of "Select Recepients" while creating new one - see here [^minor.mp4]

*Expected result:* The label should read "Select Recepients" instead of "Select a recepient", as specified in the design file - see here [^Voicemail_greeting_settings_v1_1a.png]

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: The app allows saving the new item even though the Title field is empty
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to Create New Greeting or Create Quick Status
 # Leave the Title field blank
 # Fill in other required fields
 # Tap Save

*Actual result:* The app allows saving the new item even though the Title field is empty - see here [^Screen_recording_20250602_224310.mp4]

*Expected result:* The Title field should be a mandatory input. If left blank, a validation message should appear, and should not be saved until the title is provided - see here [^

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: The toggle switch and text alignment appear above the middle, rather than being centered as per the design requirements
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings or Quick Status tab
 # Observe the position of the toggle switch and text alignment
 # Compare their placement to the design specification

*Actual result:* The toggle switch and text alignment appear above the middle, rather than being centered as per the design requirements - see here [^Screenshot 2025-06-02 214542.png]

*Expected result:* The toggle switch and text should be perfectly centered to match the design file - see here [^Voicemail_status_v1.png]

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: Time dropdown shows current device time instead of previously selected time when modifying
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to Greetings or Quick Status
 # Set a specific time for the greeting/status
 # Reopen the time dropdown to modify the time

*Actual result:* Time dropdown shows current device time instead of the previously selected time when modifying - see here [^Enhancement.mp4]

*Expected result:* The time dropdown should display the previously selected time by default, allowing the user to modify it without re-selecting from the beginning

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: Playback button resets while scrolling, but voice continues playing and clicking again overrides ongoing playback
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to either Greetings or Quick Status
 # Play any voice message
 # Scroll down the screen while the message is playing
 # Observe the playback button state and tap it again

*Actual result:* Playback button resets while scrolling, but voice continues playing, and clicking again overrides ongoing playback - see here [^Average19.mp4]

*Expected result:* The playback button should reflect the actual playback state. Scrolling should not reset the button visually. Tapping the playback button should pause or resume the same message without overlapping audio

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: Cursor in title field appears at the beginning during editing instead of at the end of the text
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to any of the Greeting or Quick Status
 # Navigate to the title field
 # Try to edit the saved title

*Actual result:* Cursor in title field appears at the beginning during editing instead of at the end of the text - see here [^Average18.mp4]

*Expected result:* The cursor should automatically appear at the end of the existing text when editing, allowing users to append or modify it easily

column1: Quick Status: ON/OFF toggle is replaced by radio button selection, not matching the specified behavior
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Quick Status tab
 # Observe the UI control used for activating status options

*Actual result:* ON/OFF toggle is replaced by radio button selection, not matching the specified behavior - see here [^Image 2025-06-02 at 12.20.09_956ef785.png]

*Expected result:* Each Quick Status should have an independent ON/OFF toggle switch to allow enabling/disabling specific statuses, as per the specification - see here [^Voicemail_status_v1.png]

column1: Header Label: Displays "GET PERSONAL" Instead of  "VOICEMAIL" in the header section as specified
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings or Quick Status section
 # Navigate to a different section/page within the app and pay attention to the header section

*Actual result:* Header Label: Displays "GET PERSONAL" Instead of  "VOICEMAIL" in the header section as specified - see here [^Voice Mail is not showing.mp4]

*Expected result:* The header should consistently display the actual app name "VOICEMAIL" across all screens - see here [^Voicemail_status_header.png]

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: Voice message continues playing when the app is minimized or the user navigates to another page
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings or Quick Status section
 # Tap Play on any voice message from the list
 # While the message is still playing, minimize the app or navigate to a different section/page within the app

*Actual result:* Voice message continues playing when the app is minimized or the user navigates to another page - see here [^Average16.mp4]

*Expected result:* Playback should automatically stop or pause when the user minimizes the app or navigates away from the playback screen

column1: Settings: Active Service Toggle: Page reloads on each toggle action instead of updating status dynamically
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the three dots at the top right corner
 # Settings > Active Service 
 # Toggle the Active/Inactive switch (ON or OFF)
 # Observe the behavior of the interface

*Actual result:*  Page reloads on each toggle action instead of updating status dynamically - see here [^Average15.mp4]

*Expected result:* Toggling the Active Service should update the status instantly without reloading the entire page, ensuring a smoother and more responsive user experience
column143: 04/Jun/25 10:34 PM;e.sheremetyev;this feature is not implemented yet;;;

column1: Greetings: Select Recepients: The Search field is missing the required "Search Contact" text as specified in the design file
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the GREETINGS > Select Recepients
 # Locate the Search field at the top of the screen
 # Observe whether the placeholder text "Search Contact" is present

*Actual result:* The Search field is missing the required "Search Contact" text as specified in the design file - see here [^Screenshot_20250602_021924.png]

*Expected result:* The Search field should contain "Search Contact" as a placeholder text according to the design specifications - see here [^Voicemail_contacts_v1b.png]

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: The Restart button does not restart the audio from the beginning while clicking
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings or Quick Status tab
 # Start playing an audio inside any specific greeting or status
 # Click the Restart button while the audio is playing
 # Observe whether the audio restarts from the beginning

*Actual result:* The Restart button does not restart the audio from the beginning; instead, it resumes playback from the current position when clicked - see here [^Screen_recording_20250602_020700.mp4]

*Expected result:* Clicking the Restart button should reset the playback to 0:00 and start the audio from the beginning

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: The greeting/status does not highlight or show an audio progress bar while playing audio
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings or Quick Status tab
 # Click on any greeting or status item
 # Start playing the audio 
 # Observe whether it highlights, and if an audio progress bar appears

*Actual result:* The greeting/status does not highlight or show an audio progress bar while playing audio - see here [^Average12.mp4]

*Expected result:* The greeting/status should highlight when played and an audio progress bar should be displayed to show the playback duration - see here [^Voicemail_disabled_service_v1a.png]

column1: Greetings: The group name does not appear after saving
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to GREETINGS → Create New Greeting
 # Select a group and save the greeting
 # Verify if the group name is displayed in the saved greeting

*Actual result:* The group name does not appear after saving in any greetings - see here [^Average11.mp4] & [^Screenshot_20250601_223221.png]

*Expected result:* The selected group name should be displayed in the saved greeting

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: Multiple voice messages play at the same time, overlapping each other, with no automatic stop of the previously playing audio
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings section
 # Tap Play on any greeting to start audio message
 # Without stopping the first playback, tap Play on another greeting
 # Repeat the same steps in the Quick Status section while current messages are playing

*Actual result:* Multiple voice messages play at the same time, overlapping each other, with no automatic stop of the previously playing audio - see here [^Average10.mp4]

*Expected result:* Only one audio message should be allowed to play at a time across both Greetings and Quick Status

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: Title fields accept input beyond 30 characters instead of 30-character as specified
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to any of the Greetings or Quick Status
 # Enter a title that exceeds 30 characters

*Actual result:* Title fields accept input beyond 30 characters instead of 30 characters as specified - see here [^Average9.mp4]

*Expected result:* The field should restrict input to a maximum of 30 characters and either block extra input or show a validation message when the limit is exceeded

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: Previous message continues playing when entering into a specific greeting or status and playing it again
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings or Quick Status section
 # Tap Play on any voice message
 # While it’s playing, enter into the same item by tapping it
 # Tap Play again from inside the opened view

*Actual result:* Previous message continues playing when entering into a specific greeting or status and playing it again - see here [^Average8.mp4]

*Expected result:* When entering into the item and playing it again, the previous playback should automatically stop, allowing only one audio instance to play at a time

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: Scrolling resets the playback button state while voice message continues playing
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings or Quick Status section
 # Tap Play on any item to start audio playback
 # While the audio is still playing, scroll down through the list

*Actual result:* Scrolling resets the playback button state while the voice message continues playing - see here [^Average7.mp4]

*Expected result:* The playback button should accurately reflect the current state, even while scrolling. If the audio is playing, the button should remain active

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: Scrolling while playing a Greeting or Status auto-enables playback buttons of other items
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to either the Greetings or Quick Status section
 # Tap Play on any greeting or status to begin audio playback
 # While the audio is playing, scroll down through the list of items
 # Observe the behavior of the playback buttons for other entries

*Actual result:* Scrolling while playing a Greeting or Status auto-enables playback buttons of other items - see here [^Average6.mp4]

*Expected result:* Only the currently playing item should show an active playback state. Scrolling should not affect the state of other playback buttons

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: More than 20 entries can be created despite maximum limit being 20 as per requirements
column27:
*OS:* Windows 11 Home 64-bit

*Browser:* Google Chrome Version 135.0.7049.85

*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings section

 # Create and save 20 different greetings

 # Attempt to create and save additional greetings

 # Repeat the same in the Quick Status section

*Actual result:* More than 20 entries can be created despite the maximum limit being 20 as per the requirements - see here [^Average5.mp4]

*Expected result:* The app should restrict creation of greetings or quick statuses to a maximum of 20 and should display a warning message
column143:
01/Jun/25 7:57 PM;m13.hasan;*Steps in corrected order:* 
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings section
 # Create and save 20 different greetings
 # Attempt to create and save additional greetings
 # Repeat the same in the Quick Status section;;;

column1: Greetings: 0.0 sec recording duration is allowed when creating a new Greeting
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Greetings 
 # Tap Create new greeting and immediately stop the recording without speaking (duration: 0.0 sec)
 # Save the recording
 # Observe the newly created greeting or status

*Actual result:* 0.0 sec recording duration is allowed when creating a new Greeting - see here [^Average4.mp4]

*Expected result:* The application should prevent saving recordings with 0.0 seconds duration and should display a warning or validation message

column1: Greetings: Audio continues to play after deleting any of the greetings until it finishes
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to any of the Greetings or Quick Status
 # Tap the Play button to start audio playback 
 # While the audio is still playing, select that greeting and delete it
 # Observe the audio behavior

*Actual result:* Audio continues to play after deleting any of the greetings until it finishes - see here [^]

*Expected result:* Once a greeting or quick status is deleted, any ongoing audio playback should stop immediately, and the player should reset
column143:
31/May/25 11:21 PM;m13.hasan;*Correction in the below:*

*Summary:* Audio Playback: Audio continues to play after deleting a Greeting or Quick Status

*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to any of the Greetings or Quick Status
 # Tap the Play button to start audio playback 
 # While the audio is still playing, select that Greeting or Quick Status and delete it
 # Observe the audio behavior

*Actual result:* Audio continues to play after deleting a Greeting or Quick Status until it finishes - see here [^Average3.mp4];;;

column1: Time Format: Application consistently displays time in 24-hour format despite the device being set to 12-hour format
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app

 # Navigate to any of the Greetings and set a time using the 24-hour format

 # Minimize the app and go to the Android device Settings

 # Change the system Time Format to 12-hour (AM/PM)

 # Return to the Get Personal Voicemail app and view the previously set time

 # Observe the time format displayed in the app

*Actual result:* Application consistently displays time in 24-hour format despite the device being set to 12-hour format - see here [^Average2.mp4]

*Expected result:* The application should adapt to the device’s selected time format, displaying time in 12-hour format (with AM/PM) when that setting is applied
column143:
31/May/25 11:03 PM;m13.hasan;*Correction:*

Actual result: Application consistently displays time in 24-hour format despite the device being set to 12-hour format - see here [^Average2-1.mp4]

*Steps:* 
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to any of the Greetings and set a time using the 24-hour format
 # Minimize the app and go to the Android device Settings
 # Change the system Time Format to 12-hour (AM/PM)
 # Return to the Get Personal Voicemail app and view the previously set time
 # Observe the time format displayed in the app;;;

column1: App Layout: Application does not utilize full screen, leaving blank space on display
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Launch the Get Personal Voicemail app on any Android device
 # Observe the screen layout on the home and settings screens
 # Compare the app frame with the physical screen dimensions

*Actual result:* Application does not utilize full screen, leaving blank space on display - see here [^Average1.mp4]

*Expected result:* The application should adjust its layout responsively to fill the full screen height and width, ensuring an optimized display on all supported devices

column1: Quick Status: 'Delete Status' button does not perform any action when tapped
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Get Personal Voicemail app
 # Navigate to the Quick Status section
 # Select an existing quick status
 # Tap the 'Delete Status' button

*Actual result:* 'Delete Status' button does not perform any action when tapped - see here [^9th major.mp4]

*Expected result:* Clicking the 'Delete Status' button should delete the selected status

column1: Greetings & Quick Status: Maximum recording duration is 9 minutes instead of 9.59 minutes as required
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Voicemail application
 # Navigate to either the Greetings or Quick Status section
 # Click Create new
 # Tap "Press to start" for recording a new message
 # Allow the recording to continue uninterrupted
 # Observe the time when the recording stops automatically

*Actual result:* Maximum recording duration is 9 minutes instead of 9.59 minutes as required - see here [^8th Major.mp4]

*Expected result:* The system should have the capability of recording up to 9.59 minutes as defined in the requirements for both Greetings and Quick Status - see here [^Voicemail_record_v1_1c.png]

column1: Settings: "Time before greeting" dropdown resets to default value (5) after navigating back to the main page
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Voicemail application
 # Click the three dots in the top right corner and navigate to the Settings
 # Locate the "Time before greeting" dropdown
 # Change the value from 5 to any other (e.g., 10 or 15)
 # Return to the main page, then go back to the same page
 # Observe the dropdown value

*Actual result:* "Time before greeting" dropdown resets to default value (5) after navigating back to the main page - see here [^7th major.mp4]

*Expected result:* The app should store and reflect the user-selected value in the "Time before greeting" dropdown even after navigation

column1: Greetings: The app takes approximately 5 seconds to navigate the recipient page after clicking the "Select a recipient" button if the user does not go back instantly
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Voicemail application
 # Enter any greeting
 # Click "Select a recepient" button
 # Wait until the page is loading

*Actual result:* The app takes approximately 5 seconds to navigate the recipient page after clicking the "Select a recipient" button if the user does not go back instantly - see here [^6th major.mp4]

*Expected result:* The page should respond and load content immediately after clicking the recipient button to ensure a smooth user experience

column1: Quick Status: Recording restarts when pausing and resuming during the creation of a new status
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Voicemail application
 # Quick Status > Create new status
 # Click "PRESS TO START" button
 # Pause the recording and resume it 
 # Pay attention to the response

*Actual result:* Recording restarts when pausing and resuming during the creation of a new status - see here [^4th major.mp4]

*Expected result:* Pausing and resuming should allow the recording to continue without restarting

column1: Greetings: Recording restarts when pausing and resuming during the creation of a new greeting
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Voicemail application
 # Greetings > Create new greeting
 # Click "PRESS TO START" button
 # Pause the recording and resume it 
 # Pay attention to the response

*Actual result:* Recording restarts when pausing and resuming during the creation of a new greeting - see here [^4th major.mp4]

*Expected result:* Pausing and resuming should allow the recording to continue without restarting

column1: Create new greeting: Pause button causes page crash when tapped frequently
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Voicemail application
 # Click on "Create new greeting" 
 # Click "Press to start"
 # Frequently tap the pause button
 # Pay attention to the response

*Actual result:* Pause button causes page crash when tapped frequently - see here [^3rd major.mp4]

*Expected result:* Frequent tapping of the pause button should not cause a crash; the page should stay responsive

column1: Settings: Purchase button does not trigger any action
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Voicemail application
 # Click the three dots on the top right side > Settings
 # Click "Purchase $2.99 
 # Pay attention to the response

*Actual result:* The Purchase button does not trigger any action, preventing the purchase from being completed - see here [^Purchase button.mp4]

*Expected result:* Clicking the purchase button should initiate the payment process

column1: Greetings: Greeting toggle automatically turns off when adding more than seven entries
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Voicemail application
 # In greetings, add the 8th greeting - see here [^more than 7.mp4]
 # Notice that the first greeting (if on) turns off automatically while scrolling down
 # Add another greeting
 # Notice that the second greeting also (if on) turns off automatically while scrolling down

*Actual result:* Greeting toggle automatically turns off when adding more than seven entries - see here [^Automatically off while scroll down .mp4]

*Expected result:* Adding new greetings should not affect the on state of existing ones while scrolling the greetings page

column1: Quick Status: The Quick Status message doesn't play during incoming calls
column27:
*Steps:* 
 # Open the Voicemail application
 # Set a quick status message and ensure that the service is active in the settings - see here [^Screenshot_20250531_164809.png]
 # Make an incoming call to the phone

*Actual result:* The Quick Status message doesn't play during incoming calls - see here [^Critical- Status.mp4]

*Expected result:*  The Quick Status message should play during incoming calls when the service is active

column1: Greetings: Greeting messages don't play during incoming calls
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Voicemail application
 # Pay attention that greeting messages are active in the settings

 # Assign a greeting message to a recipient or group

 # Set an active time and date for when the greeting should be triggered

 # Make an incoming call to the phone

*Actual result:* Greeting messages do not play during incoming calls - see here [^Critical - Greetings doesn't work.mp4]

*Expected result:* The greeting message should play automatically when an incoming call is received for assigned contacts or groups
column143:
31/May/25 1:36 PM;m13.hasan;*Steps in corrected order:*
 # Open the Voicemail application
 # Pay attention that greeting messages are active in the settings
 # Assign a greeting message to a recipient or group
 # Set an active time and date for when the greeting should be triggered
 # Make an incoming call to the phone;;;

column1: Greetings: App crashes when entering greetings, selecting a recipient, and going back immediately
column27:
*Steps:*
 # Open the Voicemail application 
 # Enter any greeting in the designated field

 # Click the "Select a recipient" option

 # Immediately try to return to the previous page

 # Observe the response 

*Actual result:* App crashes when entering greetings, selecting a recipient, and going back immediately - see here [^Critical- app crashes.mp4]

*Expected result:*  The Voicemail application should function smoothly without crashing when entering a greeting, selecting a recipient, and navigating back
column143:

 # Enter any greeting in the designated field
 # Click the "Select a recipient" option
 # Immediately try to return to the previous page
 # Observe the response ;;;
